abstract.p: BASEBALL: NOTEBOOK: Jeter Gets the Start**American League All-Star team manager Joe Torre picks Derek Jeter over Nomar Garciaparra to start at shortstop in place of injured Alex Rodriguez (S)

block.p: Because shortstop Alex Rodriguez (concussion) cannot start in the All-Star Game, Torre picked Derek Jeter over Nomar Garciaparra to start. Torre went with Jeter because he was second in the voting and because Garciaparra started last year at Fenway Park.
''It's too bad A-Rod can't play because it was a chance to have the three best shortstops in baseball on the same team,'' said Torre.

Because shortstop Alex Rodriguez (concussion) cannot start in the All-Star Game, Torre picked Derek Jeter over Nomar Garciaparra to start. Torre went with Jeter because he was second in the voting and because Garciaparra started last year at Fenway Park.
''It's too bad A-Rod can't play because it was a chance to have the three best shortstops in baseball on the same team,'' said Torre.
Jeter imitated Garciaparra's toe-tapping stance when he replaced him last year, and someone asked him if he might imitate Rodriguez, his close friend, in this year's game.
''I tried Nomar and I struck out,'' said Jeter. ''I don't know who I'm going to try this year.''
